question: Tell me, do people in your country enjoy reading?

question: Do you think reading is more important for children or for adults?
transcript: Actually, I think reading is important for both children and adults. It depends on what kind of reading for each day of human life. For example, for, you know, I think that one of the biggest benefits that reading brings to humans is that practice them in the ability to focus. And then for the children, you know, we have to practice them to focus, to think and to, to practice. For example, you know, a lot of people talk about the AI development right now and there is some, some of them suggest that we can apply to teach AI for the students. So, I mean that at a small, a small age, they can practice to focus. For the adults, I saw improved that because they are, they are busy with, in working. So, you know, they have also practice reading to improve their knowledge and also to practice, you know, when people have more concentration in something, I think that they can have a good, they can get, they can make good decision.

anti_overrating.reason: 'practice them in the ability' (train them / help them practice). 'practice them to focus' (train them to focus). 'apply to teach AI' (apply AI to teaching?). 'saw improved that' (see improvement?).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Attempts to use complex sentences but these tend to be less accurate.

question: And finally, how has technology changed the way we read?
transcript: Yes. In terms of technology change right now, I think that there is a lot of technological advancement, you know. And we change from the reading of physical book to the electronic book. And I think that is, I, at, on the, on the, I read 100 international publications per day. I think reading physical book, it also, compulsory for some further aspect. And however, you know, we say in the world we talk a lot about the sustainability, sustainable development and you will read a book you have to cut down. You have to spend from the physical to the electronics one So electronics is the more effective way to say to store the book and to have the reading And and sometimes I also bring the paper to read and to make more time to think about it So there is a lot in the pictures. I think that there are huge changes right now. Maybe the future there will be a huge change about the top book or the speaking book. I do not know exactly. Yeah. Wow.

anti_overrating.reason: 'reading of physical book' (reading physical books). 'compulsory for some further aspect' (necessary in some aspects?). 'speaking book' (audiobook).

question: So Lam, I want to sit with you now and ask you how do you feel that test went?
transcript: Yes, I actually asked you to take several IA exams in the past and I thought that the test has a strong connection with the actual exam. Really? Yeah. And the one thing I, I love that you, if you take a pro IA exam, You know, you are more friendly. You know, I will tell you now, and this is something that many students do not know, the examiners, they have to be quite strict, otherwise they get in trouble. So I am overly friendly to try and encourage students to feel more confident, but in the real test they have to be quite serious. they are very bound by time limits, so they have to follow strict time limits for each of the parts as well. So sometimes they will interrupt you.

question: Where did you learn that phrase?
transcript: Actually, I am reading a book every day, so I think that is, it is coming, it is coming, coming into my mouth randomly. So when you were speaking in the exam that came across. And that is one thing you can do to really stand out in the IELTS. You know, try to talk about something you really love or you really cared about. You care about. Yeah. overall, thank you very much. Lam, it is a pleasure to meet you today. Thank you for coming in. I appreciate your time. Come on.
